bookTitle: Totto-chan: The Little Girl at the Window
bookAuthors: Tetsuko Kuroyanagi, Chihiro Iwasaki, Dorothy Britton
Plot: This engaging series of childhood recollections tells about an ideal school in Tokyo during World War II that combined learning with fun, freedom, and love. This unusual school had old railroad cars for classrooms, and it was run by an extraordinary man--its founder and headmaster, Sosaku Kobayashi--who was a firm believer in freedom of expression and activity.
